page.title: 19Lundy's Past.
page.content: He improved the castle (see p.4) and continued to hold Lundy long after the Parliamentarian victory.Eventually Lundy once again became the haunt of pirates. In the 1700s Thomas Benson leased Lundy.He became an M.P. and took on a contract to transport convicts to Virginia and Maryland.Infact he only took them to Lundy where he put them to work,farming and building.He was also engaged in smuggling and Benson's Cave can be found just below the castle. After a succession of owners Lundy was bought in 1834 by William Hudson Heaven and thus began a period often called the Kingdom of Heaven.Certainly many improvements and developments were made by the Heavens. In 1836 Millcombe was built and a new road from the beach was constructed.{(cont)
